title: Unemployment Rates by State
question_text:
The July 2015 unemployment rates for the $50\text{ U.S. States}$ are displayed in the relative cumulative frequency graph below.
Based on this graph, what is the best estimate of the median and interquartile range?

Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.
solution:
The median is the
50
th
percentile. Locate
0.5
on the vertical axis and read across to the graph, then down to the horizontal axis. The
50
th
percentile happens at around
5.2
%
unemployment.

In a similar way, Q3 is the
75
th
percentile and Q1 is the
25
th
percentile. Locate these numbers on the vertical axis, then read across to the graph and down to the horizontal axis.

Q1 is approximately
4.2
%
and Q3 is approximately
5.9
%
, leading to an IQR estimate of
1.7
%
.

Explanation of Distractors

Choices 'A', 'B', and 'C' are incorrect. On the graph, it is clear that the median at
0.5
is above
5
.

Choice 'E' is incorrect. The IQR is the difference between the values at
0.25
and
0.75
are between
4
and
6
. The difference then must be less than
2
.
